cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north then northeast, skirting the South Carolina coast and moving inland across the NC/SC border before recurving northeast along the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Myrtle Beach, SC (between South Santee River SC and Cape Lookout NC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach, SC to south of South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River, SC to Cape Lookout, NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina and southeastern North Carolina coasts, including Charleston area
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (40–50 mph gusts) possible Saturday night through Sunday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above ground possible at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands producing 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along adjacent beaches
